definition: lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: This is a bunch of different shades of footprints, but also a section of the Universal Declaration of sound.
sentences.chinese: 這是一串深淺不一的腳印，也是一段擲地有聲的宣言。

sentences.english: I fell off my pink cloud with a thud.
sentences.chinese: 我從粉紅色的雲彩墮下，擲地有聲。

sentences.english: His stirring words again show that China-Pakistan friendship is indeed deeper than the sea.
sentences.chinese: 這擲地有聲的話語再次證明中巴友誼情比海深。

definition: to be reluctant to give up a post
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
to show every possible consideration (idiom); meticulous care
(idiom) to freely air one's views/to be heard far and wide/to attract a lot of attention
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
sharp ears and keen eyes (idiom)/keen and alert/perceptive
